New Records: Lionel Messi became the second-highest scorer in international football with his 109th goal, breaking the record for goals in the Copa América tournament with 14 goals. Argentina extended their unbeaten streak to 10 games following their victory
Key Match Events: Argentina scored two goals, with Julián Álvarez netting the opener and Lionel Messi converting an opportunity from inside the box
Canada had several chances but failed to convert, including a near miss by Jonathan David in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were heavily favored to win, and the match was celebrated on their Independence Day with a large pro-Argentina crowd in attendance
Lionel Messi expressed his enjoyment of playing football while still capable, hinting at his ongoing commitment to the national team
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi praised the team's resilience and achievements, highlighting the team's historic performance
Canada's coach acknowledged the team's efforts and the difficulty of competing against a top-tier opponent
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a temporary grass surface at MetLife Stadium, which affected gameplay due to wet conditions
The game saw a high attendance of 80,102 fans, with a significant majority supporting Argentina
